ControlledConcept.gml:description: Type of geologic unit is unknown, unspecified, irrelevant, or some type not included in the vocabulary. Type makes no implication for required properties or cardinalities. This is the root concept for the type hierarchy. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:geologic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Geologic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by bounding surfaces. Not necessarily stratified. Donovon (2004, IUGS abstract Florence) makes good case for use of a noncommittal term for the bounding surface. “While there may be no agreement that a given stratal boundary is a discontinuity, there is consensus that all the identified boundaries are stratal surfaces.” Includes: 1. Unconformity bounded units (Salvador 1994), defined by bounding stratigraphic discontinuities ('significant unconformities'; unconformity is defined as surface of erosion in Salvador 1994). 2. Sequence stratigraphic unit, an allostratigraphic unit that is used to interpret the depositional origin of sedimentary strata and assumes, though this is not always stated, an implicit connection to base level change. It does this by establishing how the sequence of strata accumulated in order in the sedimentary section over a subdividing framework of surfaces. Source: This vocabulary; Salvador, 1994; Donovon 2004 IUGS abstract.
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.a
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:allostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Allostratigraphic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by alteration process. Source: This vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.b
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:alteration_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Alteration Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined based on fossil content. Five kinds of biozones are recognized by the revised NACSN (Lenz et al., 2000, Note 64, a recommended complete replacement of Articles 48 through 54 of the North American Stratigraphic Code (NACSN, 1983) accepted for publication 2000.): range biozone, interval biozone, lineage biozone, assemblage biozone, and abundance biozone. These represent different approaches to defining and recognizing biozones. Source: Lenz et al., 2000, Note 64 (see AAPG Bulletin, v. 89, no. 11, November 2005); North American Stratigraphic Code, 1983
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.d
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:biostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Biostratigraphic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit that includes all rocks formed during a specific interval of geologic time Source: Salvador, A., 1994, International Stratigraphic Guide, Second Edition
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.e
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:chronostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Chronostratigraphic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by primary magnetic-polarity record imposed whien the rock was deposited or crystallized during a specific interval of geolgoic time. Kind of chronostratigraphic unit and kind of geophysical unit. Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 1983
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.f
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:polarity_chronostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Polarity Chronostratigraphic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by lithology independent of relationships to other units. Denotes a 'kind' of rock body characterized by lithology, e.g. basaltic rocks. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.g
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:lithologic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Lithologic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by surface landform, e.g. hummocky moraine
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.h
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:geomorphologic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Geomorphologic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by its geophysical characteristics. Denotes that the properties used to define the unit are measured by intrumental techniques, not directly observable by humans, e.g. density, magnetic susceptibility, magnetization, electrical conductivity. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.i
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:geophysical_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Geophysical Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by magnetic characteristics. Source: Salvador, A., 1994, International Stratigraphic Guide, Second Edition
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.i.a
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:magnetostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Magnetostratigraphic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined on the basis of observable and distinctive lithologic properties or combination of lithologic properties and stratigraphic relationships. Denotes a particular body of rock. Source: Salvador, A., 1994, International Stratigraphic Guide, Second Edition
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.j
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:lithostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Lithostratigraphic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Lithostratigraphic unit that lacks stratification Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 1983
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.j.a
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:lithodemic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Lithodemic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by genesis. The genesis is manifested by material properties, but the material is not the defining property. Example-- alluvial deposits, glacial deposits. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.k
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:lithogenetic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Lithogenetic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by genesis involving direct human action to deposit or modify material. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.k.a
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:artificial_ground
ControlledConcept.name: Artificial Ground

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined by human-made genesis involving excavation. Not necessarily defined by landform (a hole...), as they could have been subsequently filled/landscaped etc. If the excavation is filled becomes an excavation with artificial ground wholly or partly superimposed on it. This sort of thing can become quite important in urban geology where an excavation can be filled and landscaped. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.k.b
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:excavation_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Excavation Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit produced by gravity driven, down-slope displacemnt of material, and characterized by the type of movement giving rise to the deposit, and by how the individual movement types present in the deposit are related in time and space. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.k.c
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:mass_movement_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Mass Movement Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined defined on basis of structural or deformation features, mutual relations, origin or historical evolution. Contained material may be igneous, sedimentary, or metamorphic. Source: Neuendorf et al., 2004
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.l
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:lithotectonic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Lithotectonic Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Lithotectonic unit defined by deformation style or characteristic geologic structure observable in outcrop. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.l.a
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:deformation_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Deformation Unit

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit defined based on soil development and character. Pedoderm is not a surface classification unit because soil classification requires knowledge of the soil profile, which always extends some distance beneath the surface. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.n
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:pedoderm
ControlledConcept.name: Pedoderm

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Geologic unit that represents a single pedologic horizon in a sequence of strata (consolidated or non-consolidated). The presence of an overlying geologic unit is required, but locally the soil horizon may be at the Earth surface (in which case is may be coincident with a Pedoderm). See discussion at https://www.seegrid.csiro.au/twiki/bin/view/CGIModel/PedostratigraphicUnit Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 1983; Morrison, 1995, INQUA/ISSS newsletter, Nov. 1995, http://fadr.msu.ru/inqua/nl-archive/nl-8-11/howcan.html, ISSN 0256-2340.
ControlledConcept.gml:name: a.o
urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:GeologicUnitType:200811:pedostratigraphic_unit
ControlledConcept.name: Pedostratigraphic Unit
